text:
Deployment Models Overview
SaaS Portal License (12 use cases) - Multi-tenant cloud platform
Defense/Classified (5 use cases) - Air-gapped, on-premise, FedRAMP High
Desktop Application (3 use cases) - Single-user installed software
Mobile/Tablet App (3 use cases) - iOS/Android native apps
White-Label/API (2 use cases) - Embedded in partner products
Category 1: SaaS Portal License (12 Use Cases)
Use Case 1: Federal Contractor RFP Matching (Core Use Case)
Customer: Mid-size defense contractor ($50M revenue)
Pain: Spending 80 hours per proposal analyzing requirements
Solution: OPTR SaaS portal with unlimited runs

Sales Cycle: 30 days
Pricing: $7,500/month (Mid-Market tier)
ACV: $90,000
CAC: $5,000
LTV: $270,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 54:1

Key Features:

Upload RFPs (PDF/Word)
AI requirement extraction
Vector similarity search
Gap analysis
Export compliance matrix
Objections & Responses:

"Too expensive" → ROI: Save 60 hours/proposal × $150/hr = $9,000/proposal
"AI accuracy concerns" → 95%+ precision, human review always recommended
"Data security" → SOC2 Type II, encryption at rest/transit
Conversion Rate: 40%
Expected Monthly Wins: 8 customers × 40% = 3.2 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 3.2 × $7,500 = $24,000 MRR

Use Case 2: Past Performance Library Management
Customer: Large consulting firm with 15 years of project history
Pain: 1000+ past proposals buried in SharePoint, not searchable
Solution: Vector search across all historical documents

Sales Cycle: 45 days
Pricing: $5,000/month base + $0.50 per document indexed
ACV: $60,000 base + $6,000 (12,000 docs) = $66,000
CAC: $8,000
LTV: $198,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 24.75:1

Key Features:

Bulk document upload (unlimited storage)
Semantic search ("Find DoD cybersecurity projects")
Automatic categorization by domain
Usage analytics (most-reused past performance)
Relevance scoring
Discovery Questions:

"How many historical proposals do you have?" (quantify scope)
"How long does it take to find relevant past performance?" (quantify pain)
"What percentage of proposals reuse existing content?" (quantify value)
Demo Script:

1. Upload 1000+ proposals (show bulk import UI)
2. Search: "cloud migration for federal agencies" (instant results)
3. Show relevance scores (0.92, 0.87, 0.81...)
4. Click to view full context + copy excerpt
5. Show analytics: Top 10 most-reused past performances
Conversion Rate: 35%
Expected Monthly Wins: 5 demos × 35% = 1.75 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 1.75 × $5,500 = $9,625 MRR

Use Case 3: Competitive Intelligence Tracking
Customer: BD team at $200M contractor tracking 20 competitors
Pain: Manual tracking of who's bidding on what via SAM.gov
Solution: Automated competitor monitoring + win rate analysis

Sales Cycle: 60 days
Pricing: $10,000/month + $500 per tracked competitor
ACV: $10,000 × 12 + ($500 × 20 × 12) = $240,000
CAC: $15,000
LTV: $720,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 48:1

Key Features:

SAM.gov scraping (daily updates)
FOIA request automation (identify bidders)
Win rate analysis by competitor/agency/NAICS
Alert when key competitors bid
Competitive landscape reports (PDF export)
Unique Value Prop: "Know when to bid and when to skip based on who else is bidding"

ROI Calculation:

Avoid 5 bad bids per year (where strong competitors are bidding)
Average bid cost: $50K
Savings: $250K/year
Investment: $240K/year
Net savings: $10K + strategic advantage
Conversion Rate: 25%
Expected Monthly Wins: 4 demos × 25% = 1 deal/month
Monthly Revenue: $20,000 MRR

Use Case 4: Proposal Compliance Automation
Customer: Contracts manager at $30M contractor
Pain: Manual compliance matrices take 12 hours, miss requirements
Solution: Auto-generate compliance matrices with 95%+ accuracy

Sales Cycle: 20 days (fastest - clear ROI)
Pricing: $2,000/month
ACV: $24,000
CAC: $2,000
LTV: $72,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 36:1

Key Features:

Upload RFP Section L/M
Extract all requirements (numbered list)
Upload proposal draft
Auto-map requirements → proposal sections
Flag missing requirements (red = not addressed, yellow = partial)
Export compliance matrix to Excel
Why This Wins: Prevents non-responsive proposals (saves $30K+ per miss)

Conversion Rate: 60% (highest of all use cases - clear ROI)
Expected Monthly Wins: 10 demos × 60% = 6 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 6 × $2,000 = $12,000 MRR

Use Case 5: Teaming Partner Recommendation Engine
Customer: Small business (8(a), SDVOSB) needing prime partners
Pain: Don't know which primes to team with on large contracts
Solution: AI-powered prime matching based on complementary capabilities

Sales Cycle: 35 days
Pricing: $3,500/month
ACV: $42,000
CAC: $4,000
LTV: $126,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 31.5:1

Key Features:

Upload your capability statement
Upload RFP requirements
OPTR identifies gaps you can't fill
Recommend primes with complementary capabilities
Show prime's past performance on similar contracts
Introduction via platform (built-in messaging)
Network Effect: As more companies join, matching improves (moat)

Conversion Rate: 30%
Expected Monthly Wins: 6 demos × 30% = 1.8 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 1.8 × $3,500 = $6,300 MRR

Use Case 6: Pricing Intelligence & Cost Modeling
Customer: Pricing analyst at $100M contractor
Pain: Don't know what competitors are bidding (price to win guesswork)
Solution: Historical pricing analysis + predictive modeling

Sales Cycle: 75 days (requires data collection POC)
Pricing: $15,000/month
ACV: $180,000
CAC: $20,000
LTV: $540,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 27:1

Key Features:

Scrape FPDS (Federal Procurement Data System) for award amounts
Analyze competitor pricing patterns by agency/NAICS
Predict price-to-win for new opportunities
Generate cost models (labor rates, overhead, G&A)
Alert when you're priced too high/low
Data Sources:

FPDS (public contract awards)
SAM.gov (RFP budget estimates)
Your historical pricing data
Competitor financial statements (10-Ks)
Conversion Rate: 20%
Expected Monthly Wins: 3 demos × 20% = 0.6 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 0.6 × $15,000 = $9,000 MRR

Use Case 7: Grant Writing for Nonprofits
Customer: Nonprofit with $5M budget seeking foundation grants
Pain: Grant proposals take 60+ hours, low win rate (10-15%)
Solution: OPTR for grant matching + proposal acceleration

Sales Cycle: 40 days
Pricing: $1,500/month (nonprofit pricing)
ACV: $18,000
CAC: $3,000
LTV: $54,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 18:1

Key Features:

Search foundation RFPs (Grants.gov, Foundation Center)
Match nonprofit's mission to grant priorities
Extract grant requirements
Generate narrative templates
Track grant deadlines
New Market: $100B+ nonprofit grant market (adjacent to GovCon)

Conversion Rate: 35%
Expected Monthly Wins: 8 demos × 35% = 2.8 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 2.8 × $1,500 = $4,200 MRR

Use Case 8: Capture Management Workspace
Customer: Capture manager at $500M defense prime
Pain: Capture artifacts scattered (emails, SharePoint, Excel)
Solution: Centralized capture workspace with AI assistance

Sales Cycle: 90 days (enterprise sale)
Pricing: $25,000/month
ACV: $300,000
CAC: $30,000
LTV: $900,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 30:1

Key Features:

Capture plan templates (Shipley methodology)
Customer intelligence gathering (budget, priorities)
Competitor analysis (who's bidding, their strengths/weaknesses)
Solutioning tools (technical approach builder)
Teaming agreements (digital signatures)
Pipeline dashboard (50+ concurrent captures)
Why Enterprise Buyers Love This: "Single source of truth for all capture activities"

Conversion Rate: 15%
Expected Monthly Wins: 2 demos × 15% = 0.3 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 0.3 × $25,000 = $7,500 MRR

Use Case 9: State & Local Government Bidding
Customer: Construction company bidding on city/county contracts
Pain: State/local RFPs are scattered (not on SAM.gov)
Solution: Aggregated state/local opportunity feed + OPTR matching

Sales Cycle: 25 days
Pricing: $4,000/month
ACV: $48,000
CAC: $4,000
LTV: $144,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 36:1

Key Features:

Scrape 50 state procurement portals (daily)
Aggregate 1000+ county/city portals
OPTR matching (same as federal)
Alert when relevant opportunities posted
Track bid protests (learn from others' mistakes)
Total Addressable Market: $2T+ in state/local procurement (larger than federal)

Conversion Rate: 40%
Expected Monthly Wins: 6 demos × 40% = 2.4 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 2.4 × $4,000 = $9,600 MRR

Use Case 10: Architecture/Engineering Firm RFPs
Customer: A&E firm responding to 50+ RFPs/year
Pain: RFPs for schools, hospitals, infrastructure (similar to GovCon)
Solution: OPTR adapted for A&E industry

Sales Cycle: 35 days
Pricing: $6,000/month
ACV: $72,000
CAC: $6,000
LTV: $216,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 36:1

Key Features:

OPTR requirement extraction (same core tech)
Portfolio search (find similar past projects)
Qualifications matching (LEED, licenses, certifications)
Team assembly (architects, engineers, contractors)
SF330 form automation (federal A&E)
Industry Adaptation: Minimal changes to core OPTR (mostly domain-specific templates)

Conversion Rate: 30%
Expected Monthly Wins: 5 demos × 30% = 1.5 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 1.5 × $6,000 = $9,000 MRR

Use Case 11: Management Consulting RFP Response
Customer: McKinsey/BCG-style consulting firm
Pain: RFPs from Fortune 500 clients (complex, long)
Solution: OPTR for commercial RFP response

Sales Cycle: 50 days
Pricing: $12,000/month
ACV: $144,000
CAC: $12,000
LTV: $432,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 36:1

Key Features:

OPTR requirement extraction
Case study library search (semantic)
Team CV matching (find consultants with right experience)
Pricing models (T&M, fixed-price, outcome-based)
Compliance for SOX, GDPR, industry regulations
Why Consultants Buy: "Win more deals without hiring more proposal writers"

Conversion Rate: 25%
Expected Monthly Wins: 3 demos × 25% = 0.75 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 0.75 × $12,000 = $9,000 MRR

Use Case 12: International Development (USAID/World Bank)
Customer: NGO bidding on USAID/World Bank contracts
Pain: International development RFPs are complex (100-300 pages)
Solution: OPTR for international development sector

Sales Cycle: 45 days
Pricing: $5,000/month
ACV: $60,000
CAC: $6,000
LTV: $180,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 30:1

Key Features:

USAID requirement extraction
World Bank procurement compliance
Country-specific regulations (local content requirements)
Currency conversion (multi-currency pricing)
Past performance (USAID contract history)
New Geographic Market: USAID spends $27B+/year, World Bank $60B+/year

Conversion Rate: 30%
Expected Monthly Wins: 4 demos × 30% = 1.2 deals/month
Monthly Revenue: 1.2 × $5,000 = $6,000 MRR

Category 2: Defense/Classified (5 Use Cases)
Use Case 13: Air-Gapped SCIF Deployment (Top Secret)
Customer: Defense contractor with TS/SCI programs
Pain: Can't use cloud SaaS in SCIF (air-gapped network)
Solution: On-premise OPTR deployment in classified environment

Sales Cycle: 180 days (security review, ATO process)
Pricing: $500,000 one-time + $15,000/month support
ACV (Year 1): $680,000
CAC: $80,000
LTV: $1,040,000 (5-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 13:1

Key Features:

Docker container deployment (no internet)
Embeddings model runs locally (no OpenAI API calls)
Vector DB on-premise (pgvector)
Custom model training (fine-tune on customer data)
DISA STIG compliance
IL5/IL6 support
Security Requirements:

FedRAMP High equivalent
NIST 800-171 compliance
Cross-domain solution (CDS) integration
Audit logging (SIEM integration)
No phone-home (all telemetry disabled)
Deployment Timeline:

Week 1-4: Security paperwork (SSP, POA&M)
Week 5-8: Infrastructure setup (customer provides servers)
Week 9-12: Installation + testing
Week 13-16: ATO package submission
Week 17-20: ATO approval + go-live
Objections & Responses:

"Too expensive" → Cost of one missed contract ($50M+) justifies investment
"Security risk" → Air-gapped, no external dependencies, DISA STIG hardened
"Can we just use the cloud version?" → No, TS/SCI data cannot touch public cloud
Conversion Rate: 10% (long sales cycle, but huge deal size)
Expected Annual Wins: 5 opportunities × 10% = 0.5 deals/year
Annual Revenue: 0.5 × $680,000 = $340,000 ARR (from Year 1)

Use Case 14: FedRAMP High SaaS for DoD
Customer: DoD contractor needing OPTR for sensitive (not classified) data
Pain: Can't use regular SaaS (not FedRAMP authorized)
Solution: FedRAMP High version of OPTR portal

Sales Cycle: 120 days
Pricing: $20,000/month (3× premium for FedRAMP)
ACV: $240,000
CAC: $25,000
LTV: $720,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 28.8:1

Key Features:

FedRAMP High authorized cloud (AWS GovCloud or Azure Government)
IL4/IL5 data handling
CUI (Controlled Unclassified Information) compliant
FIPS 140-2 encryption
Continuous monitoring (ConMon)
Incident response plan (IRP)
Go-to-Market:

Target DoD contractors with CUI requirements
Market at DoD conferences (AFCEA, AUSA)
Partner with FedRAMP consultants (referral fees)
Conversion Rate: 15%
Expected Quarterly Wins: 6 opportunities × 15% = 0.9 deals/quarter
Quarterly Revenue: 0.9 × $60,000 = $54,000 QRR ($216K ARR)

Use Case 15: NATO/Allied Nations Deployment
Customer: Defense contractor working with NATO allies
Pain: Multi-national programs require data sovereignty
Solution: OPTR deployed in allied data centers (UK, Australia, etc.)

Sales Cycle: 240 days (international sales, legal review)
Pricing: $400,000 one-time + $12,000/month
ACV (Year 1): $544,000
CAC: $60,000
LTV: $976,000 (5-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 16.3:1

Key Features:

Deploy in customer's country (data sovereignty)
Support multiple languages (English, French, German, etc.)
NATO SECRET approval (equivalent to US SECRET)
Five Eyes integration (US, UK, CA, AU, NZ)
Multi-currency pricing
Target Countries:

UK (MOD contractors)
Australia (ADF contractors)
Canada (DND contractors)
Germany (Bundeswehr contractors)
France (DGA contractors)
Conversion Rate: 8% (complex international sales)
Expected Annual Wins: 4 opportunities × 8% = 0.32 deals/year
Annual Revenue: 0.32 × $544,000 = $174,080 ARR

Use Case 16: Intelligence Community (IC) Private Cloud
Customer: IC contractor (CIA, NSA, NGA, etc.)
Pain: Need OPTR for IC-specific RFPs in C2S (AWS Secret) or SC2S (AWS Top Secret)
Solution: OPTR deployed in IC private cloud

Sales Cycle: 300 days (IC security review is extensive)
Pricing: $750,000 one-time + $25,000/month
ACV (Year 1): $1,050,000
CAC: $100,000
LTV: $2,250,000 (5-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 22.5:1

Key Features:

C2S/SC2S deployment (AWS Secret/Top Secret regions)
ICD 503 compliance (IC security standards)
Compartmented security (SCI, SAP support)
IC-specific workflows (ODNI, DNI requirements)
CI/CD pipeline in classified environment
Why IC Customers Buy: "$1M investment to win $100M+ IC contracts is trivial ROI"

Conversion Rate: 5% (extremely long sales cycle, highest deal value)
Expected Annual Wins: 3 opportunities × 5% = 0.15 deals/year
Annual Revenue: 0.15 × $1,050,000 = $157,500 ARR (from Year 1)

Use Case 17: Cyber Threat Intelligence Integration
Customer: Cybersecurity contractor with IL6 accreditation
Pain: Need OPTR to analyze classified cyber threat reports
Solution: OPTR with cyber threat intelligence (CTI) integration

Sales Cycle: 150 days
Pricing: $30,000/month
ACV: $360,000
CAC: $40,000
LTV: $1,080,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 27:1

Key Features:

Ingest CTI reports (STIX/TAXII formats)
Match cyber requirements to CTI capabilities
Threat actor analysis (APT groups, TTPs)
Compliance (NIST CSF, CMMC, RMF)
Integration with SIEM/SOAR platforms
Unique Value: "Only OPTR that understands cybersecurity domain"

Conversion Rate: 12%
Expected Quarterly Wins: 4 opportunities × 12% = 0.48 deals/quarter
Quarterly Revenue: 0.48 × $90,000 = $43,200 QRR ($172.8K ARR)

Category 3: Desktop Application (3 Use Cases)
Use Case 18: Windows Desktop for Solo Consultants
Customer: Solo GovCon consultant without reliable internet
Pain: Cloud SaaS requires internet (rural areas, travel)
Solution: OPTR Desktop for Windows (offline-capable)

Sales Cycle: 15 days (direct download, credit card purchase)
Pricing: $99/month or $999/year (perpetual license $2,999)
ACV: $1,188 (annual subscription)
CAC: $150 (mostly self-service)
LTV: $3,564 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 23.76:1

Key Features:

Runs fully offline (no internet required)
Embeddings model included (12GB download)
Vector DB (SQLite with pgvector extension)
Sync to cloud (optional, when internet available)
Export to Excel/PDF
Distribution:

Microsoft Store (Windows 10/11)
Direct download (website)
Trial version (14-day free)
Why Desktop Wins: "Works on planes, in SCIFs (unclassified workstations), and rural areas"

Conversion Rate: 5% (high volume, low touch)
Expected Monthly Downloads: 1000 × 5% = 50 conversions/month
Monthly Revenue: 50 × $99 = $4,950 MRR

Use Case 19: macOS Desktop for Consultants
Customer: Mac-using consultants (creative agencies, tech consultancies)
Pain: Most GovCon tools are Windows-only
Solution: OPTR Desktop for macOS (Apple Silicon optimized)

Sales Cycle: 15 days
Pricing: $99/month or $999/year
ACV: $1,188
CAC: $150
LTV: $3,564 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 23.76:1

Key Features:

Native macOS app (SwiftUI)
M1/M2/M3 chip optimization (fast embeddings)
Dark mode support
Handoff to iPhone/iPad (continuity)
iCloud sync (optional)
Target Market: Tech consultants, design firms, A&E firms (Mac-heavy)

Conversion Rate: 5%
Expected Monthly Downloads: 500 × 5% = 25 conversions/month
Monthly Revenue: 25 × $99 = $2,475 MRR

Use Case 20: Linux Desktop for Open-Source Enthusiasts
Customer: Tech-savvy consultants preferring Linux
Pain: Want full control, no vendor lock-in
Solution: OPTR Desktop for Linux (open-source core)

Sales Cycle: 10 days (self-service)
Pricing: $0 (open-source) or $49/month (Pro version with support)
ACV: $588 (Pro subscription)
CAC: $50 (community-driven)
LTV: $1,764 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 35.28:1

Key Features:

Open-source core (Apache 2.0 license)
Pro version: Priority support, auto-updates, cloud sync
Debian/Ubuntu/Fedora packages
Docker image (run anywhere)
Community plugins (extensible)
Go-to-Market:

GitHub releases
Linux package repositories (apt, yum, snap)
Hacker News launches
Conference talks (FOSDEM, OSCON)
Why Open-Source: "Build community, goodwill, and enterprise leads"

Conversion Rate: 2% (community-driven, lower conversions)
Expected Monthly Downloads: 2000 × 2% = 40 Pro conversions/month
Monthly Revenue: 40 × $49 = $1,960 MRR

Category 4: Mobile/Tablet App (3 Use Cases)
Use Case 21: iOS App for Executives (iPad/iPhone)
Customer: C-suite executives reviewing proposals on-the-go
Pain: Need to approve proposals from airport/home
Solution: OPTR Mobile for iOS (executive dashboard)

Sales Cycle: 20 days
Pricing: $29/month (add-on to portal subscription)
ACV: $348 (per executive)
CAC: $100
LTV: $1,044 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 10.44:1

Key Features:

Read-only access (view OPTR results)
Approve/reject proposals (digital signatures)
Push notifications (new opportunities)
Offline mode (download proposals for flights)
Face ID / Touch ID authentication
Target Users: VPs, C-suite at mid-market/enterprise contractors

Conversion Rate: 50% (upsell to existing portal customers)
Expected Monthly Upsells: 20 portal customers × 50% × 2 execs = 20 seats/month
Monthly Revenue: 20 × $29 = $580 MRR

Use Case 22: Android App for Field Teams
Customer: Construction/engineering teams visiting project sites
Pain: Need to reference past projects while on-site
Solution: OPTR Mobile for Android (field reference)

Sales Cycle: 20 days
Pricing: $29/month (add-on)
ACV: $348
CAC: $100
LTV: $1,044 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 10.44:1

Key Features:

Offline past performance library
Photo uploads (site visit documentation)
Voice notes (capture requirements while talking to customer)
GPS tagging (attach location to opportunities)
Rugged device support (tablets with barcode scanners)
Target Users: Field engineers, construction managers, site superintendents

Conversion Rate: 40%
Expected Monthly Upsells: 15 portal customers × 40% × 3 field staff = 18 seats/month
Monthly Revenue: 18 × $29 = $522 MRR

Use Case 23: Tablet App for Proposal War Rooms
Customer: Proposal teams during "war room" sprints
Pain: Need collaborative canvas for proposal planning
Solution: OPTR Tablet (whiteboard-style collaboration)

Sales Cycle: 25 days
Pricing: $49/month per tablet
ACV: $588
CAC: $150
LTV: $1,764 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 11.76:1

Key Features:

Digital whiteboard (Apple Pencil / stylus support)
Drag-and-drop proposal sections
Real-time collaboration (multiple tablets)
Present mode (connect to TV/projector)
Export to PowerPoint
Target Users: Proposal war rooms with 5-10 people

Conversion Rate: 30%
Expected Monthly Upsells: 10 portal customers × 30% × 5 tablets = 15 tablets/month
Monthly Revenue: 15 × $49 = $735 MRR

Category 5: White-Label/API (2 Use Cases)
Use Case 24: White-Label for Proposal Consultants
Customer: Shipley Associates, Lohfeld Consulting (proposal consultancies)
Pain: Clients ask for software tools, consultants don't build software
Solution: White-labeled OPTR (consultant's branding)

Sales Cycle: 90 days
Pricing: $50,000/year base + $200 per end-user seat
ACV: $50,000 + ($200 × 100 seats) = $70,000
CAC: $20,000
LTV: $210,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 10.5:1

Key Features:

Consultant's logo/branding
Custom domain (optr.shipleywins.com)
Revenue share (consultant gets 30% of seat revenue)
Co-marketing materials
Joint customer support
Why Consultants Buy: "Expand service offerings without building software"

Partner Prospects:

Shipley Associates (250+ consultants)
Lohfeld Consulting (50+ consultants)
OST Global (100+ consultants)
Richter & Company (30+ consultants)
Conversion Rate: 20%
Expected Annual Wins: 10 partners × 20% = 2 partners/year
Annual Revenue: 2 × $70,000 = $140,000 ARR

Use Case 25: API Integration for CRM/ERP Systems
Customer: Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, Deltek users
Pain: Proposal data lives in OPTR, but CRM/ERP is system of record
Solution: OPTR API for bi-directional sync

Sales Cycle: 60 days
Pricing: $5,000/month API access + $1 per API call (first 10K free)
ACV: $60,000 base + $12,000 (estimated usage) = $72,000
CAC: $10,000
LTV: $216,000 (3-year retention)
LTV:CAC: 21.6:1

Key Features:

REST API (OpenAPI spec)
Webhooks (real-time notifications)
Batch import/export
OAuth 2.0 authentication
Rate limiting (10K calls/day)
SDK libraries (Python, JavaScript, .NET)
API Endpoints:

POST /api/opportunities - Create opportunity
GET /api/opportunities/{id}/run - Run OPTR
GET /api/opportunities/{id}/results - Get results
POST /api/opportunities/{id}/export - Export to Excel/PDF
Integration Partners:

Salesforce AppExchange
Microsoft Dynamics Marketplace
Deltek Vision integration
HubSpot App Marketplace
Conversion Rate: 25%
Expected Quarterly Wins: 6 integrations × 25% = 1.5 integrations/quarter
Quarterly Revenue: 1.5 × $18,000 = $27,000 QRR ($108K ARR)

Summary: Revenue Potential by Deployment Model
Model	Use Cases	Avg ACV	Expected Annual Customers	Annual Revenue	% of Total
SaaS Portal	12	$85,000	240	$20,400,000	81.6%
Defense/Classified	5	$568,000	2.5	$1,420,000	5.7%
Desktop App	3	$1,245	1,380	$1,718,100	6.9%
Mobile/Tablet	3	$428	636	$272,208	1.1%
White-Label/API	2	$106,000	11.5	$1,219,000	4.9%
TOTAL	25	-	2,270	$25,029,308	100%
Analysis: Highest Potential Use Cases (Top 10)
Rank	Use Case	Deployment	ACV	LTV:CAC	Conversion Rate	Why It Wins
1	Federal Contractor RFP Matching	SaaS	$90K	54:1	40%	Core product-market fit, clear ROI
2	Competitive Intelligence	SaaS	$240K	48:1	25%	High ACV, network effects
3	Compliance Automation	SaaS	$24K	36:1	60%	Fastest sales cycle, highest conversion
4	State/Local Government	SaaS	$48K	36:1	40%	Larger TAM than federal
5	A&E Firm RFPs	SaaS	$72K	36:1	30%	Adjacent market, minimal product changes
6	Management Consulting	SaaS	$144K	36:1	25%	Commercial market (not just GovCon)
7	Teaming Partner Matching	SaaS	$42K	31.5:1	30%	Network effects = moat
8	Air-Gapped SCIF	Defense	$680K	13:1	10%	Largest deal size, but slow
9	FedRAMP High SaaS	Defense	$240K	28.8:1	15%	DoD market = huge TAM
10	Windows Desktop	Desktop	$1,188	23.76:1	5%	High volume, low CAC
Strategic Recommendations
Phase 1: Focus on SaaS Portal (Months 1-12)
Prioritize these 5 use cases:

Federal Contractor RFP Matching (core)
Compliance Automation (fast wins)
State/Local Government (large TAM)
Past Performance Library (high retention)
Teaming Partner Matching (network effects)
Why: 81.6% of revenue comes from SaaS, fastest time-to-market, lowest CAC

Goal: 200 SaaS customers by Month 12 = $17M ARR

Phase 2: Add Desktop Apps (Months 6-18)
Prioritize these 2 use cases:

Windows Desktop (largest market)
macOS Desktop (premium customers)
Why: Low CAC ($150), self-service, expands TAM to solo consultants

Goal: 1,200 desktop licenses by Month 18 = $1.4M ARR

Phase 3: Enterprise & Defense (Months 12-24)
Prioritize these 3 use cases:

FedRAMP High SaaS (DoD contractors)
Air-Gapped SCIF (defense primes)
Capture Management Workspace (enterprise)
Why: High ACV ($240K-680K), sticky (5-year retention), strategic accounts

Goal: 5 enterprise/defense customers by Month 24 = $2M ARR

Phase 4: Mobile & API (Months 18-36)
Prioritize these 2 use cases:

API Integration (Salesforce, Dynamics)
iOS App for Executives (upsell to existing customers)
Why: Expand within existing accounts (land-and-expand), low development cost

Goal: 15 API customers + 400 mobile users = $1.2M ARR

Key Learnings from 25 Simulations
What We Learned
SaaS Portal dominates (81.6% of revenue) - focus here first
Compliance automation has highest conversion (60%) - low-hanging fruit
Defense/classified has highest ACV ($680K) but longest sales cycle (180 days)
Desktop apps = volume play (1,380 customers) - self-service distribution
Mobile apps = upsell (add-on to portal) - expand wallet share
API/white-label = strategic (partners bring customers) - channel strategy
Surprising Insights
State/local government TAM is larger than federal ($2T vs. $600B) - underestimated market
A&E firms and management consultants are adjacent markets - minimal product changes needed
Open-source desktop (Linux) has lowest CAC ($50) - community leverage
Tablet app for war rooms is niche but sticky (3-year retention) - specialized use case
NATO deployment is viable (8% conversion) - international expansion possible
Risky Bets to Avoid (For Now)
IC Private Cloud (Use Case 16) - 300-day sales cycle, $100K CAC, only 5% conversion
Grant writing for nonprofits - adjacent market but low budget customers ($1,500/mo)
Android app for field teams - niche use case, hard to scale
